com.bombinggames.wurfelengine.core.Gameobjects

Interface HasID

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEntity, AbstractGameObject, AnimatedBlock, BenchmarkBall, Block, Bullet, Cursor, DestructionParticle, EntityBlock, EntityShadow, Explosion, MovableEntity, Particle, ParticleEmitter, PlayerWithWeapon, PointLightSource, RenderBlock, Sea, SimpleEntity, Weapon

    public interface HasID
    Interface for objects whether they are blocks and entities.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getSpriteId

        byte getSpriteId()
        returns the id of a object
        Returns:

      • getSpriteValue

        byte getSpriteValue()
        Get the value. It is like a sub-id and can identify the status.
        Returns:
        in range [0;Block.VALUESNUM]. Is -1 if about to destroyed.

      • setSpriteValue

        void setSpriteValue(byte value)
        Set the value.
        Parameters:
        value - in range [0;Block.VALUESNUM]. Is -1 if about to destroyed.

      • getLightlevelR

        float getLightlevelR()
        How bright is the object? The lightlevel is a scale applied to the color. 1 is default value.
        Returns:
        1 is default bright. 0 is black.

      • getLightlevelG

        float getLightlevelG()
        How bright is the object? The lightlevel is a scale applied to the color. 1 is default value.
        Returns:
        1 is default bright. 0 is black.

      • getLightlevelB

        float getLightlevelB()
        How bright is the object? The lightlevel is a scale applied to the color. 1 is default value.
        Returns:
        1 is default bright. 0 is black.

      • setLightlevel

        void setLightlevel(float lightlevel)
        Set the brightness of the object. The lightlevel is a scaling factor. 1 is default value.
        Parameters:
        lightlevel - 1 is default bright. 0 is black.

      • isTransparent

        boolean isTransparent()
        Can light travel through object?
        Returns:

      • isObstacle

        boolean isObstacle()
        Is this object an obstacle or can you pass through?
        Returns:

      • hasSides

        boolean hasSides()
        Is the block a true block with three sides or does it get rendered by a single sprite?
        This field is only used for representation (view) related data.
        Only used for blocks. Entities should return false.
        Returns:
        true if it has sides, false if is rendered as a single sprite

      • isLiquid

        boolean isLiquid()
        A liquid has some physical properties which differ from solid blocks. The surface is rendered only once.
        Returns:

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Read the name of a id value combination.
        Returns:
        the name for this block.

      • isIndestructible

        boolean isIndestructible()
        Returns:
